item.title: Pokémon 30th Anniversary TCG Set Revealed For 2026 Release
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon has revealed the first teaser for a special anniversary TCG launching worldwide later this year, featuring reprints of classic cards from over the years.

Showcased during the Pokémon Presents stream celebrating 30 years of the franchise, a first look detailed some of the cards that are set to return.

Pokémon TCG Anniversary Set Revealed

In a teaser trailer, fans were shown a slew of cards, including Charizard from the original base set, Pikachu & Zekrom Tag Team from the Sun & Moon era, along with Lv. X, V, Crystal, and other gimmicks from over the years.

No release date for the anniversary TCG set was shared, nor was the set name, but the set is likely to drop in the West as a holiday set this summer.

For the first time, the set will debut simultaneously across the world, unlike the usual procedure where Japan gets the latest TCG set months ahead of the rest of the world.

The final sign off teased that “the future awaits,” showcasing Mew and Mewtwo with a striking color palette.

The list below contains all of the historic Pokémon cards shown during the trailer:

  • Charizard (Base Set)
  • Lugia (e-Series Crystal)
  • Palkia Lv. X
  • Uxie (Diamond & Pearl)
  • Giratina & Darkrai (Legends)
  • Genesect EX
  • Solgaleo GX
  • Zacian V
  • Pikachu & Zekrom GX (Tag Team)
  • Raikou (Amazing Rare)
  • Arceus VStar

What are your first impressions of the Pokémon 30th anniversary TCG set? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

]For more Pokémon, take a look at everything announced during the Pokémon Day showcase, and check out the release window for Pokémon Champions.

item.title: Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness Coming to Nintendo Switch Online in March
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness, the classic Nintendo GameCube title, is coming to Nintendo GameCube classics in March. The announcement was made during the recent Pokémon Presents: 30th Anniversary livestream. No specific date was announced.

The game was originally released in August 2005, and was a console released more in line with the traditional Pokémon RPG games on Nintendo’s handheld consoles at the time. The game also featured the debut of Munchlax and Bonsly. It received mediocre reviews at the time, but plenty of fans are excited to have access to it again.

Pokémon Colosseum, which was released first on GameCube, was not shown during the presentation.

Pokémon Is Showing Lots of Love to the Mid-2000s

The Pokémon Company also recently announced that Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen would be available on Nintendo Switch 2. The titles are available now, bringing those Game Boy Advance classics back to players.

Unlike Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness, those games are not available on Nintendo Switch Online. Rather, they are full digital downloads available for $20 per game.

Insider Gaming will provide further news on the game’s release when a release date is announced. Check out everything that was announced during the 30th Anniversary Pokémon Presents livestream here.

For more Pokémon on Insider Gaming, learn who Lady Gaga says is her favorite Pokémon by checking out the commercial they ran during Super Bowl 60.

How do you feel about the announcement of Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness coming to Nintendo Switch Online in March? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: New Pokémon Pokopia Features Revealed During Pokémon Presents 2026
item.content:encoded:
Some brand new details were revealed for Pokémon Pokopia ahead of its imminent March 5 release date. These were shared during the special Pokémon Presents showcase, which celebrated Pokémon’s 30th Anniversary as a franchise.

Pokémon Pokopia is the latest spinoff title for the series, and you’ll take control of a Ditto with the ability to transform into a human. You’ll attract and gather new Pokémon to join your island as you create various habitats to create a world in your vision.

New Details For Pokémon Pokopia

Three major new details were shared for Pokémon Pokopia during the showcase, the first being a brand new Rotom form, DJ Rotom.

Throughout Pokopia, you’ll be able to find and collect CDs and give them to DJ Rotom to play. These range from classic Pokémon soundtracks to brand-new hits, and you can switch them on the go.

Next up was Greedent’s reveal, who was introduced as Chef Dente. Greedent will teach you how to cook different meals, which can be consumed by the player character to improve certain moves, or fed to different Pokémon you’ve collected. Each Pokémon will favor different foods, so you’ll want to discover new recipes to keep everyone happy and fed!

Finally, there were some new details pertaining to multiplayer. Pokopia will support up to four players in online multiplayer, and it was revealed that you can play a form of hide and seek with your friends. As Ditto, you can also transform into a variety of objects to help you hide around the island, as well as build large structures together.

Are you excited to try out Pokémon Pokopia? Share your thoughts on the upcoming title in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Pokémon content, check out whether they’re coming to Fortnite, as well as the differences between Fire Red and Leaf Green.
